intro: Gilia alpina, commonly known as the alpine gilia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Gilia alpina thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky soils and meadows. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine ecosystems and a subject of interest for botanists and hikers alike.
